Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. B. Ahern) Bertie Ahern
Speaker.P: I should say at the outset that the primary responsibility for training for industry rests with industry.

CERT are the State agency with the function of co-ordinating the education, recruitment and training of personnel for the hotel, catering and tourism industry with particular reference to the direct needs of tourism. Throughput on CERT training programmes in 1988 was over 7,500 including 4,580 already employed in the industry whose skills were being updated. A similar throughput is projected for 1989. asked the Minister for Industry and Commerce in respect of Irish Steel the amount of money which has been spent on (a) upkeep and (b) investment in the last ten years and the profit/loss in each of those years.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Industry and Commerce (Mr. R. Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Industry and Commerce (Mr. R. Burke)
Speaker.P: Capital investment by Irish Steel totalled £68.4 million in the ten years to 30 June 1988. Maintenance expenses are a day-to-day matter for the company and are not separately reported on. Irish Steel's annual reports and accounts, which show its profit and loss for each of the last ten years, are available in the Dáil Library.

asked the Minister for the Marine if his Department will provide the necessary finance to construct a pier at Ardgroom, Bantry, County Cork to facilitate the mariculture development in the area; and if the work be carried out this year.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Marine (Mr. Daly) Brendan Daly
Speaker.P: My Department's engineer is to carry out a full examination of the facilities at Ardgroom in the near future to assess what improvements, if any, are necessary to accommodate the expansion in growth of mariculture in the area. Until his report is to hand and a full economic appraisal, having regard to the present financial constraints, is carried out, I cannot say what funds, if any, will be made available for works at Ardgroom.

asked the Minister for the Marine the financial and other resources he plans to make available to the Cork Free Port management group in order that the Cork Free Port can be marketed adequately both at home and abroad.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Marine (Mr. Daly) Brendan Daly
Speaker.P: I have recently appointed a manager for Ringaskiddy Free Port whose main function will be the promotion of the free port area. I have also appointed an advisory committee to assist him in his tasks. It will now be a matter for the manager and the advisory committee to draw up their plans for marketing the free port and to co-ordinate effective co-operation of the relevant state agencies in the marketing and promotion of the free port.

asked the Minister for the Marine whether he has any proposals to amend the Harbours Act, 1946, in order to transfer responsibility for Balbriggan and Skerries Harbours, County Dublin from Dublin Port and Docks Board to Dublin County Council.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Marine (Mr. Daly) Brendan Daly
Speaker.P: The question of responsibility for Balbriggan and Skerries Harbours will be examined in the context of a review of the Harbours Acts, 1946 to 1976 which I hope to put in train as soon as possible but it is probable that transfer of responsibility for the harbours to the relevant local authority will be proposed.
asked the Minister for the Environment the number of houses built by Letterkenny Urban District Council, County Donegal, in each of the last ten years.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly) Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.P: The number of houses completed by Letterkenny UDC in 1979 was 34. With regard to the years 1980-87, I would refer the Deputy to the reply to Question No. 218 of 19 April 1988. In 1988, no houses were completed by the council.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Keeffe Mr. J. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment whether Structural Funds are available from the EC to finance the completion of a sewerage scheme in Ballylicken, County Cork, which is one of the main tourist areas in the region; whether any application has been made for such funding; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: There are no proposals before my Department in relation to a sewerage scheme for the area referred to by the Deputy.

asked the Minister for the Environment the reason a house improvement grant is not being paid to a person (details supplied) in County Kerry; and if he will make a statement on the matter, having regard to the fact that all works were completed in accordance with the certificate of approval issued on 11 December 1987.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly) Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.P: A report has been requested from the Department's inspector and the applicant will be notified of the outcome.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Skerries (Dublin) New Fire Station.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment when it is envisaged that work will commence on the building of a new fire station at Skerries, County Dublin.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: The preliminary proposals submitted have been the subject of correspondence and of discussion between officers of my Department and of the fire authority. The submission of revised proposals by the fire authority is awaited.
asked the Minister for the Environment when it is envisaged that work will commence on the building of a new library at Skerries, County Dublin.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: This is primarily a matter for Dublin County Council. Plans and specifications for the proposed library were approved in February 1987. No further proposals for construction of the library have been received from the county council.
asked the Minister for Health the speech therapy facilities which are available for handicapped children in County Kerry; and if he has any plans to improve this facility.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. O'Hanlon) Rory O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: The provision of speech therapy services in County Kerry is a matter for the Southern Health Board. There is at present one senior speech therapist and a vacancy exists for one basic grade therapist and I am keeping in touch with the board about this matter.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Utilisation of Patients' Moneys.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health the amount of money held by each of the health boards on behalf of patients who have died intestate and who have no living relatives; the way in which the moneys should be utilised; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. O'Hanlon) Rory O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: In any case where patients die intestate and with no ascertainable next-of-kin the Minister for Finance, under the terms of the Succession Act, 1965, is the ultimate intestate successor.
I have asked the health boards to extract, in so far as is possible, the information requested by the Deputy and I will communicate further with him at an early date.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Public Geriatric Beds.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health the number of public geriatric beds in each county for each 1,000 population.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. O'Hanlon) Rory O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: The table below contains the information requested by the Deputy and refers to the year 1987:
Numbers of Public Geriatric Beds in Each County per 1,000 Population, 1987.

MainHeading.P: The figures above include all health board geriatric hospitals and homes and welfare homes as well as long stay district hospitals. Geriatric services funded under contract with voluntary approved and private nursing homes are not included in these statistics.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health if it is his intention to devise a proper statutory funding scheme for the rape crisis centres in view of the essential service being carried out at these centres; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. O'Hanlon) Rory O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: I do not intend to devise a statutory funding scheme for rape crisis centres. Detailed arrangments for counselling and medical services for rape victims are the responsibility of the health boards. I accept that voluntary organisations play an important role in counselling such victims.

asked the Minister for Health, in view of the fact that there were five applicants for early retirement among the nursing staff at a home (details supplied) in County Kerry and only two redundancies granted, if his Department issued any directive or advice to the Southern Health Board as to the way in which the two being granted should be chosen, from the five applicants; if his Department directed that the redundancy-early retirement be granted to the two nurses with the longest service-grade; if his Department directed that it be granted to the two nurses with the longest employment with the Southern Health Board; and whether the criteria used in the case of the two nurses who were granted redundancy-early retirement were the same as those in other hospitals within the Southern Health Board region and in other health board regions.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. O'Hanlon) Rory O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: Agencies were informed that in instances where more applications for early retirement were received than it was possible to facilitate in a particular grade regard should be had to the date of application and to the length of service.

I understand that in the case referred to by the Deputy, the Southern Health Board selected staff for early retirement on the basis of their length of service with the board. My Department were not directly involved in the selection process.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Long-Term Hospital Patient Entitlements.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health the entitlements which are due to a person (details supplied) in Dublin 9 who is a long-term hospital patient; the reason he has not received payments since he entered hospital; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. O'Hanlon) Rory O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: I have had inquiries made of the Eastern Health Board in this case and have been informed that the board have no record of any application for assistance from the person in question. I would suggest that he contact the community welfare services of the board with a view to ascertaining his entitlements, if any.

asked the Minister for Defence whether any progress has been made in negotiations with Dublin County Council for the establishment of a military history museum at Ardgillan House and Park, County Dublin.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Defence (Mr. Noonan, Limerick West) Michael J. (Limerick West) Noonan
Speaker.P: , Limerick West): The question of establishing a military museum is still under consideration. Having regard to the nature of the undertaking and the substantial resources which would be required, an early decision is unlikely.

asked the Minister for Education if she will make arrangements for the provision of funding for primary schools to cover outlay incurred in respect of health charges levied where children have to be taken direct from school to hospital casualty departments.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: It would be in accordance with general practice in cases of this kind that any hospital charges be levied on the parents. This procedure avoids difficulties in relation to the payment of a charge where there is no liability e.g. for dependants of medical card holders. Any such costs involved would not be considered an appropriate charge on my Department's funds.

asked the Minister for Education whether, in view of the number of pupils attending the second level school in the Skerries area, County Dublin, she will provide sufficient funding to enable the school to include German as a full time subject option.

asked the Minister for Education whether, in view of the number of pupils attending the second level school in the Skerries area, County Dublin, she will provide sufficient funding to enable the school to appoint a full time teacher of physical education.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos.69 and 70 together.

At present my Department are paying for 30 part time teaching hours per week, the equivalent of 1.5 posts, in excess of the authorised quota in this school. These hours are being funded partly to facilitate the provision of physical education in the school.

I am aware of the benefits of providing a second modern continental language on school curricula and this is a matter which is at present under consideration in my Department. The question of providing for the teaching of German in this school will be considered in this context.

asked the Minister for Education if she has received an application from Ballylinan GAA Club, County Laois, for funds from the national lottery; if that club is eligible for such funding; and if she will make a statement on her intentions in this regard.

asked the Minister for Education if she has received an application from Doon GAA Club, County Offaly for funds from the national lottery; if that club is eligible for such funding; and if she will make a statement on her intentions in this regard.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Question Nos. 71 and 72 together. Grants up to the limit of funds available have already been allocated under the capital grants scheme for the provision of recreational facilities. No formal application has yet been received from Doon GAA Club, County Offaly.

asked the Minister for Education if she will allow Kerry Vocational Education Committee to advertise for the vacant position of principal in Killarney; and if she will allow this position to be advertised nationally.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The question of the appointment of a principal teacher in Killarney Vocational School is at present under consideration and I hope shortly to be in a position to issue a decision on it to the County Kerry VEC.
asked the Minister for Education when an extension will be built for a primary school (details supplied) in County Wexford; and if construction will take place in 1989.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: My Department are at present awaiting the submission of planning permission by the school authorities for the approved extension to the national school in County Wexford referred to by the Deputy. When planning permission has been received the preparation of tender documents will be put in hands. It is my intention that there will be no undue delay within my Department concerning this project.
asked the Minister for Education the reason for the delay in the commencement of construction of a primary school (details supplied) in County Wexford; and when construction will start.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: It has been agreed to grant aid the provision of the new national school in County Wexford referred to by the Deputy. The preparation of tender documents for the project is in hands and will be completed at the earliest possible date. When the tender documents have been completed, I will be in a position to consider the invitation of tenders for the project and I will then communicate a decision in this respect to the school authorities.

I am not in a position at this stage to say when building works may commence. This project has been the subject of much examination in my Department and discussions with the school authorities which have, of necessity, been time consuming.

asked the Minister for Education the present position regarding full approval for a new primary school (details supplied) in County Wexford; and if financial provision will be made for the construction of this in 1989.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I recently met a delegation from the national school in County Wexford referred to by the Deputy. I am considering the proposals put to me then and I will communicate a decision to the school authorities at an early date.

asked the Minister for Energy the cost of the upkeep of the Whiddy Oil terminal, County Cork, in each of the years since it came into public ownership; and the amount which has been invested in it in each of those years.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Energy (Mr. Smith) Minister for Energy (Mr. Smith)
Speaker.P: The INPC assumed ownership of the Whiddy Island teminal on 16 June 1986. The remit of the corporation is to maintain the facility in such a condition to allow it to play a viable role as a reactivated terminal in the future. No. capital expenditure has arisen to date.
The maintenance cost has been as follows: 1986, £250,000; 1987, £432,000; 1988 (Estimated), £475,000.
